verses.text: Do not let your tongue bring you to ruin, and do not become an enemy through what you say.
verses.comment: Speech has the power to build or destroy relationships. It anticipates New Testament teaching on the tongue's power, linking wisdom tradition in both Testaments.

verses.text: Do not be drawn into the snares of your own mouth, for evil speech is like a deadly trap.
verses.comment: Self-control in words protects from needless conflict and spiritual harm. The wisdom literature often warns against careless speech.

verses.text: If you give in to pride, your destruction will be quick, and you will eat up your own leaves, leaving yourself barren like a dried-up tree.
verses.comment: Pride leads to self-destruction and isolation. The imagery of a tree highlights spiritual barrenness resulting from arrogance.

verses.text: An evil soul will destroy those who possess it, making them a laughingstock among their enemies.
verses.comment: Inner corruption manifests outwardly, inviting mockery and judgment. Spiritual health is always relational in biblical wisdom.

verses.text: A gentle word brings many friends, and fair speaking is a sign of good dealings.
verses.comment: Harmony in relationships flows from gentle speech, anticipating Jesus' teaching about peacemakers and love for neighbor.

verses.text: Let those who are at peace with you be many, but let your trusted advisers be one in a thousand.
verses.comment: Balance between hospitality and discernment in close relationships mirrors the Church's call to unity and selectivity in leadership.

verses.text: If you would gain a friend, prove him first, and do not be quick to trust him.
verses.comment: True friendship requires time and testing, foreshadowing calls to accountability and spiritual discernment in Christian community.

verses.text: For some are friends for their own convenience, but they will not remain in time of adversity.
verses.comment: Friendship rooted only in self-interest is fleeting; biblical wisdom seeks the lasting and sacrificial relationships modeled by Christ.

verses.text: There are friends who turn into enemies, revealing shame and conflict instead of trust.
verses.comment: False friends betray, ultimately recalling Judas' betrayal of Jesus who modeled perfect faithfulness.

verses.text: Never trust your enemy; like iron rusts, his malice will return.
verses.comment: Human hearts are often fickle; discernment and caution are biblical virtues, a theme repeated throughout salvation history.

verses.text: Even if he is humble before you and walks bowing low, be careful, and beware of him.
verses.comment: Appearances can deceive; true conversion of heart is proven by lasting faithfulness.

verses.text: He will wipe away your footprints and stand against you.
verses.comment: Enemies erasing evidence highlights deceitfulness and foreshadows spiritual enemies who oppose God's purposes.

verses.text: He will shake his head and clap his hands, and whisper many things, changing his face a thousand times.
verses.comment: False friends and enemies alike show instability, a foil to Christ's steadfastness. Spiritual discernment is essential.

verses.text: A faithful friend is a secure shelter; whoever finds one has found a great treasure.
verses.comment: True friendship is rare and invaluable, reflecting the deep bond believers are called to in Christ and His Church.

verses.text: Nothing compares to a faithful friend; his goodness outweighs gold and silver.
verses.comment: The value of spiritual kinship and love surpasses material wealth, echoing Christ's teaching on storing up treasures in heaven.

verses.text: A loyal friend is an elixir of life, and those who fear the Lord will find one.
verses.comment: Friendship is a spiritual gift, reserved for those who seek the Lord. The theme anticipates the Christian call to love.

verses.text: Whoever fears the Lord will direct his friendship right, for as he is, so will his friend be.
verses.comment: True friendship flows from reverence for God, forming the basis for spiritual unity and mutual sanctification.

verses.text: My son, from your youth up, seek wisdom, and in old age you will yet find understanding.
verses.comment: Early pursuit of wisdom leads to lifelong blessings. Echoes Solomon's instruction and anticipates spiritual growth into maturity.

verses.text: Come to her as one who plows and sows, and wait for her good fruits; for in working with wisdom, you will labor a little and soon eat from her harvest.
verses.comment: Wisdom is likened to fruitful labor, linking Old Testament agricultural imagery with spiritual growth and reward.

verses.text: She is hard to reach for the undisciplined, but to the diligent she quickly reveals herself.
verses.comment: Discipline is required to find wisdom. Prefigures spiritual perseverance in the Christian journey.

verses.text: She appears harsh to the unwise; the fool cannot remain with her.
verses.comment: Wisdom challenges and corrects, a process embraced by those who are humble—critical for spiritual progress.

verses.text: She will weigh heavy upon him like a great stone, and he will not delay to cast her from him.
verses.comment: Rejecting wisdom brings difficulty, foreshadowing the burden of sin that Christ offered to carry for humanity.

verses.text: For wisdom is like her name, and is not revealed to many.
verses.comment: Wisdom remains hidden to those who are not receptive; recall Jesus praising the Father for hiding truths from the wise (Matt. 11:25).

verses.text: Listen, my son, and accept my advice, do not reject my instruction.
verses.comment: Parental exhortation to pursue wisdom points to spiritual formation by trusted teachers—a foundation for apostolic tradition.

verses.text: Restrain your feet from her paths, do not wander astray, lest you fall.
verses.comment: Moral boundaries guide the believer, recalling the role of God's Word in keeping one steadfast.

verses.text: Once you find her, do not let her go; she will be your joy and gladness.
verses.comment: Embracing wisdom brings joy. Spiritual truth, once discovered, is a source of lasting happiness.

verses.text: Search with all your strength and keep straight on her paths; do not grow weary, for you will find rest.
verses.comment: Seeking wisdom foreshadows Jesus' invitation to the weary for rest, both spiritually and practically.

verses.text: At last you will find her and she will be changed into joy for you.
verses.comment: Effort in pursuing wisdom is rewarded with lasting spiritual happiness—a Christological theme of suffering preceding glory.

verses.text: Her bonds will become strong protection and her chains will be a robe of glory.
verses.comment: Wisdom's discipline transforms into splendor—echoes the idea of spiritual submission producing glory, anticipating the vestments of holiness in the heavenly life.

verses.text: Her yoke is a golden ornament, and her bonds are a blue ribbon.
verses.comment: Yoke imagery alludes to Christ's easy yoke—obeying God's wisdom brings beauty and dignity.

verses.text: You will wear her as a glorious robe and put her on as a crown of joy.
verses.comment: Wisdom clothes the soul with honor—anticipates the 'crown of righteousness' promised to the faithful (2 Tim. 4:8).

verses.text: If you wish, you can be taught; and if you devote yourself, you will be wise.
verses.comment: Free will and perseverance are required; wisdom is both God's gift and our response.

verses.text: If you love to listen, you will learn; if you pay attention, you will become wise.
verses.comment: Love for instruction is key to growth—emphasizes the role of tradition and authority in spiritual formation.

verses.text: Stand in the assembly of the elders, cling to their wisdom.
verses.comment: Participating in communal life and learning from spiritual leaders is pivotal, mirroring the Church's structure and leadership.

verses.text: Be willing to listen to every godly discourse, and do not let wise instruction pass you by.
verses.comment: Openness to godly counsel helps in spiritual growth, reinforcing the importance of faithful teachers and community.

verses.text: If you see an intelligent man, visit him often; let your feet wear out his doorstep.
verses.comment: Diligence in seeking out spiritual mentors reflects the importance of apostolic succession and tradition in the faith.

verses.text: Reflect on the commandments and meditate on them, and the Lord will give your heart understanding.
verses.comment: Contemplative meditation of God's Law brings deep understanding—echoes the practice of prayer and meditation leading to wisdom and intimacy with God, as modeled by Christ.
